title: Indonesia’s Response to COVID-19: Between Economics, Public Health, and Social Media
abstract: Since the early outbreak in the country, Indonesia has been juggling to synergize the economic and public health also social media interest. Unlike other countries, who straightaway imposed many social restriction measures such as city and national lockdowns, Indonesia was trying not to impose such restriction immediately. Instead, it tries to downplay the outbreak panic by framing that Indonesia was having the outbreak under control, therefore was still open for business and tourism.
journal: The Reshaping of China-Southeast Asia Relations in Light of the COVID-19 Pandemic
